isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS - Circuit Function And Diagnostics - Oil Water Lamp (OWL) and Engine Warning and Protection System (EWPS)

svcproc.title: Oil Water Lamp (OWL) and Engine Warning and Protection System (EWPS)

svcsubproc.title: Signal Functions

figure.caption: Function Diagram for Oil / Water Lamp and Engine Warning and Protection Systems

svcsubproc.para: The red oil and water lamp and the engine alarm buzzer are turned on when conditions are present that will cause impending damage to the engine. The level of protection is dependent on which engine warning and protection system (EWPS) is turned on in the ECM. See EXTENDED DESCRIPTION. When the ignition switch is in the ON position power is available at the OWL lamp and alarm. The lamp and the alarm are turned ON when the ECM provides a path to ground.

svcsubproc.title: Fault Detection / Management
svcsubproc.para: An open or short to ground can be detected in the OWL circuit during an On Demandengine standard test by the technician. A momentary bulb check can also be visually observed each time the ignition switch is turned on by the operator.
To troubleshoot the OWL circuit see:

para.hotlnk: Oil Water Lamp/Engine Warning and Protection System Circuit Diagram
Oil Water Lamp/Engine Warning and Protection System Circuit Diagnostics

figure.caption: Oil Water Lamp / Engine Warning and Protection System

note.para: Before doing any diagnostic test, check OWL lamp and determine if it is burnt out.

table.title: Oil Water Lamp / Engine Warning and Protection System Circuit Diagnostics

entry.para: Key-ON Engine-OFF Voltage Checks(Check voltage with ECM chassis connector (black) unplugged, breakout box installed, ignition key ON, and engine OFF.)
Fuse for instrument cluster and OWL lamp.
Battery voltage should be present from F1 to buzzer, if no voltage is present, check circuit for an open or short circuit.
Battery voltage should be present from lamp circuit to ECM, if no voltage is present, check circuit for open or short.
Harness Resistance Check (Check with ECM chassis connector (black) unplugged, instrument cluster connector unplugged, and ignition key OFF.) (Fuse F1 removed)
Continuity from ECM to cluster connector for OWL lamp.
Continuity from ECM to buzzer connector.
Continuity from instrument cluster connector to buzzer.
Continuity from instrument cluster connector to fuse.
Physical check - with breakout box installed momentarily ground ECM chassis pin 54, the OWL lamp should illuminate if the OWL circuit is good.

The OWL lamp can be commanded on for test purposes with the EST by requesting an output state check. If the OWL circuit checks out good to this point and does not turn on when an output state check is commanded, either the ECM is defective or the feature is not turned on.
263 = OWL output circuit check diagnostic trouble code detected during a key ON engine OFF standard test, possible open or short in OWL.

svcsubproc.title: Extended Description
svcsubproc.para: This group of parameters customizes the engine warning and protection feature. The engine warning and protection system safeguards the engine from undesirable operating conditions in order to prevent engine damage and prolong engine life. When a warning condition is detected, the on-board electronics will illuminate the OIL/WATER lamp and activate the warning buzzer.

When a critical condition is detected, the on-board electronics will shut down the engine if the engine warning and protection system has its protection features enabled. After an engine shutdown, the operator may restart the engine for a thirty second run time if desired.
The event logging feature will record when an excessive (i.e., critical) engine event has occurred in both engine hours and odometer readings. Currently there are four states of electronic operation.
This parameter indicates to the on-board electronics the desired mode of operation for the engine warning and protection feature.
Engine overspeed and engine overheat are provided as the default operating mode. No engine shutdown is available.
Engine overspeed, engine overheat, engine oil pressure, and low coolant level are provided as the engine warning operating mode. No engine shutdown is available.

Engine overspeed, engine overheat, engine oil pressure, and low coolant level are provided as the engine protection operating mode. Engine shutdown is available if an engine critical condition is detected. Critical engine conditions include overheat, low oil pressure and low coolant level.
Engine overspeed, engine overheat and low engine oil pressure are provided as the engine warning operating mode. No engine shutdown is available.
This parameter indicates when an engine overheat warrants the OIL/WATER lamp to be illuminated and the warning buzzer to be activated.
This parameter indicates when an engine overheat condition warrants an engine shutdown. The event logging feature will log when this event occurred in both engine hours and odometer readings.
This parameter indicates the rpm range for which engine oil pressure level 1 is to be used for the loss of engine oil pressure detection.
This parameter indicates the rpm range for which engine oil pressure level 2 is to be used for the loss of engine oil pressure detection.
This parameter indicates the rpm range for which engine oil pressure level 3 is to be used for the loss of engine oil pressure detection.
This parameter indicates when a loss of engine oil pressure warrants the OIL/WATER lamp and warning buzzer activation
This parameter indicates when a loss of engine oil pressure warrants the OIL/WATER lamp and warning buzzer activation
This parameter indicates when a loss of engine oil pressure warrants the OIL/WATER lamp and warning buzzer activation.
This parameter indicates when a loss of engine oil pressure warrants an engine shutdown. The event logging feature will log when this event occurred in both engine hours and odometer readings.
This parameter indicates when a loss of engine oil pressure warrants an engine shutdown. The event logging feature will log when this event occurred in both engine hours and odometer readings.
This parameter indicates when a loss of engine oil pressure warrants an engine shutdown. The event logging feature will log when this event occurred in both engine hours and odometer readings.

para.emph: Oil Water Lamp OCC Diagnostic Trouble Code

svcsubproc.para: The Output Circuit Test, performed during an On Demand Engine Standard Test, will test the Oil Water Lamp circuit for an open or short condition. If an out of range condition exists, Diagnostic Trouble Code 263 will be set.
See the appropriate diagnostic circuit diagram:

para.hotlnk: Engine Warning Lights/Alarm and Test Switch Circuit Diagram;
